description: Displays general system information, including firmware version, serial number, and uptime.
Shows real-time CPU and memory usage.
Displays the firewall's active session table.
Shows the complete routing table of the FortiGate.
Displays detailed status information of all IPsec VPN tunnels.
Shows the configuration of a specific firewall policy.
Lists all network interfaces and their current configuration.
Reads the most recent system crash logs.
Shows detailed hardware information for a specific network interface.
Starts a packet capture on an interface with a specific filter, showing full packet details.
Filters the debug flow output based on an address, port, etc. (e.g., 'addr 1.1.1.1').

command: diagnose debug flow show function-name enable
description: Shows the function names in the debug flow output for better analysis.
Starts a trace of the packet flow through the system for a number of packets.
Enables debug output.
Disables debug output.

command: diagnose vpn ike log filter name <tunnel_name>
description: Filters IKE logs for a specific IPsec VPN tunnel.
Displays real-time process information, similar to 'top' in Linux.
Lists all configured IP pools and their usage.
Displays the system's ARP table.
Shows a list of kernel network interfaces.
Performs a standard ping test to a host or IP address.
Performs a traceroute to follow the path to a destination.
Reboots the FortiGate device.
Shuts down the FortiGate device.
Backs up the system configuration to a connected USB drive.
Restores the system configuration from a connected USB drive.
Forces an immediate update check for FortiGuard services.
Enter global configuration mode.
Enter firewall policy configuration mode.
Enter IPsec VPN phase 1 configuration mode.
Displays the entire running configuration, including default values.
Low-level command to view interface configuration, similar to 'ifconfig' in Linux.
